newsitem.title: USA: Farberware plant operations to be suspended.
newsitem.headline: Farberware plant operations to be suspended.

text.p: Operations at a South Bronx Farberware plant are expected to be suspended if a contract is not extended between US Industries Inc and Syratech Corp.

Syratech, which owns Farberware housewares and the equipment at the plant, has a manufacturing agreement that expires September 6 with US Industries, the previous owner of Farberware, US Industries said. US Industries had an agreement with the Empire State Development Corp to maintain operations at the 700-employee plant, said Empire State Development, which holds a lease agreement with U.S. Industries.

US Industries vice president of investor relations Diana Burton said the company made a good faith effort to keep the plant open, but Syratech had not made a contract offer that was economically viable for U.S. Industries to stay on.
US Industries would like to continue manufacturing at the plant, or help find a new manufacturer, but it would like Syratech and the local government to help, Burton said.
Syratech was not immediately available for comment.
Empire State Development said it has several investors interested in the plant and it would pursue legal remedies if the plant ceases operations.
